jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

A64284F6EEFD4BBF84C57642EE0BADB2.description:
Identify the goods and
services used by the Church.

788280DDD0CD4EB98538CC5D8BB8CE10.description:
Identify public goods and
services that students or
families use.

C5F1F096343E49E6A2628BC76F474721.description: Understand the impact of government policies and decisions on production and consumption in the economy. Understand the moral implications of policies and decisions on production and consumption. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7

7A43E131D0DE4F5C929A5F5C83A75B22.description:
Describe a trade that has been
made and why the people
agreed to trade; tell why it is
or isn’t fair and moral.

2CE496E0D0C14E359A570DD5A505F3A4.description:
Give examples of barter in the
economy.

68F4317CA317446E953BA22272B41260.description: Understanding trade as an exchange of goods or services. Understand moral values behind the understanding of trade as an exchange of goods and services. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7

7721294CC221419A91488A3CFE3B9B9B.description:
Explain the moral choices
that producers make and how
they affect the community.

5E4068DF761A4C2B85C6CE808D5E3BA1.description:
List examples of human,
natural, and capital resources.

2BEBE8F0B84942038603FB7B89CE865E.description:
Explain that people who make
goods and services are
producers.

BB7CFA232C8D4D1F838CFBD240D93084.description:
Understand that scarcity necessitates choices by producers. Understand that scarcity necessitates producer choices which have moral implications. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7         Value and develop a love for the common good and our shared humanity, not just with those around us, but for those who have gone before
and those who will come after us. CSDS2 (7-12 CS)

46B163F186814478B49E457F90BC11D8.description:
Identify ways in which scarce
items might be distributed in
the classroom, Church, and/or
community (e.g., 10 cookies
for 20 children).

54B695CAF04E450396E84E63EF97E6CB.description:
Identify a choice students
have made based on wants
and needs.

D7F6E13F52154EAF8235F57810EB4364.description:
Describe times when students
or families have been
consumers.

BB1760602EAB4FF68CE3A9EE3235C10D.description: Understand that scarcity necessitates choices by consumers. Understand that scarcity necessitates consumer choices which have moral implications. Discriminate between what is positive in the world, what needs to be transformed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4    Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7

56F6EE20275E40399D8AD35B1F518FE2.description:
Discuss the meaning and
importance of stewardship.

4FF5771196EC43F09964FF1B80DE0EC7.description:
Match workers in the
community to the goods and
services they produce.

ACEC09DEF761420590A41AA428D8182B.description:
Identify jobs students might
do to earn pay.

2349C798262E492C9C32F3324B6E1FEE.description:
Explain how a family makes
an economic or moral choice.

51B71B61B1AD43CC92FDC74E39649464.description:
List and categorize goods and
services families consume.

F7C59919FB6C4ABBA926D00A4811100A.description: Understand how different economic systems operate in exchange, production, distribution and consumption of goods and services. Understand the moral consequences of how different economic systems operate in exchange, production, distribution and consumption of goods and services. Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7 (7-12 CS)        Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions .CSIS7 (K-6 CS)

550541F2E0984083BA06A659FC555B04.description: Understand economic systems with an emphasis on the United States. Understand moral aspects of the economic systems of the United States.
